Summary: The Stephen Riady Centre at the National University of Singapore's University Town will be the venue for the NUS Career Fest 2025. This event guide provides students with important information about the various activities and opportunities available at the career fest. The guide includes details on the career fair, networking sessions, workshops, and talks by industry professionals. Students can also access resources such as career counselling, resume clinics, and mock interviews to help them prepare for their future careers. The event aims to connect students with potential employers and provide them with valuable insights into the job market.

The NUS Career Fest 2025 is an event aimed at helping students pave their career paths and plan for their future. It will take place on 18, 19, and 20 February 2025 at the Stephen Riady Centre in University Town. This event guide will provide students with information on how to make the most out of their participation.

The dress code for NUS Career Fest 2025 is Business Casual, which includes options such as business shirts with trousers or skirts, polo t-shirts with jeans or skirts, sleeved blouses with jeans or trousers, and smart dresses. Tank tops, sportswear, bermudas, mini-skirts, slippers, and other inappropriate attire are not allowed. It is important to dress appropriately and respectfully as you will be meeting with employers from different sectors. Business casual attire includes business shirts with trousers and belts, polo t-shirts with jeans, and crew neck t-shirts with blazers and jeans or trousers.

The NUS Career Fest 2025 will have over 300 employers participating over three days. It is important to review the list of employers and shortlist target companies to research beforehand. Each day will have different employers present, so it is recommended to attend multiple days to meet a variety of employers. To maximize the benefits of the event, students can sign up for a pre-event preparatory talk called "Navigating NUS Career Fest 2025." The guide suggests students use the acronym P-R-E-P-A-R-E to plan for the event.

The NUS Career Fest 2025 Student Event Guide encourages students to visit NUS TalentConnect to explore full-time job and internship opportunities. Students are advised to stay updated on industry trends and developments through news, articles, and resources. The guide also suggests attending the Future-ready Skills and Growth Mindset talk for insights on essential skills in the Green, Digital, and Care economies. For those interested in sustainability, there is a Green Connect 2025 event on 5 February, where students can meet employers and industry experts in the sustainability sector. Research is emphasized as a key aspect for success in the job market.

Prepare for the NUS Career Fest and your job search by participating in pre-event activities and meeting with a career advisor. Attend talks and submit feedback forms for a chance to win vouchers. Your career advisor can also provide personalized advice and assistance with resume, elevator pitch, interview prep, and personal brand statement. Don't just visit employer booths, but also check out other event activities and talks. By attending at least two days of the career fest and submitting a feedback form, you can enter the Grand Draw to win prizes such as an iPad Pro, Sony headphones, and a Samsung watch.

The event guide advises students to consider their unique brand, values, strengths, and skills in order to enhance their self-understanding. They are encouraged to attend a pre-event talk on personality profiling tests and to think about the employers they are targeting. Students should also update their NUS TalentConnect and LinkedIn profiles. It is important to dress professionally in business casual attire for the NUS Career Fest 2025, as first impressions are powerful and students may be refused entry if not appropriately dressed.

The Event Guide advises students to prepare their resumes early for the NUS Career Fest 2025 event. They can find helpful steps and tips on the CFG website and use VMock for an AI-powered resume critique. Students can also attend resume clinics conducted by CFG career advisors for further guidance. Additionally, they can submit their resume to employers by scanning a QR code at the booth.

The Elevator Pitch is an important aspect of NUS Career Fest 2025. It involves conveying your unique value proposition in a memorable and impactful manner. To prepare, you should have a self-introduction and elevator pitch based on your personal brand statement. It is recommended to customize a few pitches for the specific employers you plan to meet at the fair. Practice and rehearse with friends, using VMock, and with CFG career advisors before the fair. If you need a last-minute tune-up, visit the QuickPrep Career Corner for a 20-minute chat with CFG career advisors. For more digital career resources, visit the CFG website. See you at NUS Career Fest 2025!

To participate in NUS Career Fest 2025, all students must register and check-in with a unique QR code from NUS TalentConnect. To retrieve the QR code, students must download the app and select the "QR Code Check-In" option. This QR code is necessary for entry into the fair.

The NUS Career Fest 2025 event will have a directory available at the end of January 2025 that lists all participating employers and their booth locations and event day activities. Students can refer to this directory to plan their visit and make the most of the event.

On February 18, NUS Career Fest 2025 will feature a live illustration session with Yiming, a talented Year 3 student at Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and a renowned illustrator. Attendees can also get a free professional headshot to enhance their LinkedIn profile and resume. The event will also include various fun activities and talks.

On the event day, students can participate in various activities to prepare for their careers. They can receive last-minute advice from career advisors at the Styled for Success booth, get makeup and grooming tips from Sephora at the QuickPrep Career Corner, and attend a masterclass on fragrance profiling and makeup for job interviews. Additionally, they can recharge at the Prep & Gear Up Zone with a free cup of coffee from the Coffee Kiosk.

The event offers various activities for students to explore opportunities for further studies and upskilling, understand career interests and pathways, and receive tips for navigating adulthood. The Lifelong Learning Institute's Rediscover Yourself Corner and NUS Lifelong Learning booth provide information on continuous learning courses and alumni perks. The Thrive by Business Times corner offers advice on adulting. In the Discovery & Play Zone, students can navigate through game levels to explore career resources and play an interactive age simulation game by NTUC Health to understand the world of seniors. Participation in these activities may result in a complimentary gift.

NUS Career Fest 2025 is a physical event happening on 18, 19 & 20 February 2025 from 10 am to 5pm. Over 300 employers from various industries will be present, offering thousands of job opportunities. Prior to the career fair, there will be pre-event activities to help students prepare for the fair and their overall career development. The event will take place at Stephen Riady Centre, University Town. Employers may differ each day, so students are encouraged to attend more than one day to engage with a wider range of companies. A list of employers can be found in the Student Event Guide.

The document provides answers to frequently asked questions about NUS Career Fest 2025. It explains that the list of participating employers can be found in the Student Event Guide and encourages students to prepare for the event by following the tips in the guide. Students can register their interest to attend and must check-in upon arrival. There is a dress code for the event and students not dressed appropriately will not be allowed entry. The purpose of the career fair is to meet a variety of employers from different industries.
The NUS Career Fest 2025 Terms and Conditions can be found in the Student Event Guide. For any inquiries about the event, please email [REDACTED_EMAIL].

The participant's registration for the NUS Career Fest 2025 signifies their acceptance of the terms and conditions outlined in the document. The organizers reserve the right to make changes to the event details or cancel the event if necessary, and may also decline registrations or remove content that violates the terms. Participants are expected to comply with NUS policies and the Code of Student Conduct, and are not allowed to post or transmit any material that is defamatory, discriminatory, threatening, or violates any laws or regulations. Additionally, participants must not post any harmful or disruptive programs or materials that are protected by intellectual property rights without proper consent.

The terms and conditions of the NUS Career Fest may portray NUS in a negative light. Participants are not allowed to impersonate others, send spam emails, share passwords, or use information from the event to harm others. In line with NUS Safe Management Measures, participants must wear masks and take personal and social responsibility, especially when interacting with vulnerable individuals. Those with COVID-19 symptoms or a positive test result should stay at home. If the 24-Hr PSI exceeds 100, outdoor activities may be suspended, but indoor events will continue. Healthy participants should wear N95 masks for prolonged exposure, while elderly, pregnant, and those with chronic health conditions are advised to minimize exposure.

Participants of the NUS Career Fest 2025 are required to wear their event wristband at all times as identification. Failure to do so may result in refusal of entry or being asked to leave. If the wristband is lost, a replacement can be obtained at the Student Registration Counter. Participants must keep all confidential information received during the event confidential, and may only disclose it to necessary employees or if required by law. Participants also consent to the collection and use of their personal data for the purposes of the event and future promotional activities. This is subject to NUS' Privacy Notice and legal information and notices.

Participants of the NUS Career Fest 2025 event acknowledge and agree that recordings may be taken of them during the event and that all intellectual property rights for these recordings will belong to NUS. By attending the event, participants give consent for these recordings to be used for future marketing purposes by CFG. Participants must comply with data protection laws and only use personal data for the purposes it was disclosed for. They must also take measures to protect personal data and report any incidents to NUS. Personal data should not be retained for longer than necessary and should only be disclosed to those who need to know. Participants must not disclose or transfer personal data to any third parties without the individual's consent.

The Terms and Conditions for the NUS Career Fest 2025 state that the event is governed by the laws of Singapore. Any disputes will be resolved through arbitration administered by the Singapore International Arbitration Centre. The Grand Draw, organized by the Centre for Future-ready Graduates, is open to current NUS students who attend at least two days of the event and submit a feedback form. By participating, students agree to the Terms and allow their personal data to be used for the purposes of the Grand Draw.

The qualifying period for the Grand Draw is from 18 February [REDACTED_PHONE]H to 26 February [REDACTED_PHONE]H (Singapore time). Submissions received after the closing date will not be considered. Prizes include an Apple iPad Pro, Sony headphones, and a Samsung Galaxy Watch7. Winners will be selected randomly and contacted via their NUS email. Winners must confirm receipt of the notification within 3 days and provide requested information for verification. If a winner does not respond or breaches the terms, a replacement winner will be chosen. Prizes are not transferable and subject to availability. NUS employees, employers, and their families are not eligible to participate. NUS is not responsible for technical issues

NUS reserves the right to cancel or modify the Grand Draw and its prizes at any time. CFG's decisions regarding the Grand Draw and prizes are final and no correspondence will be entertained. The Instagram Giveaway for NUS Career Fest 2025 is organized by CFG and will be governed by the published Terms. By participating, you agree to be bound by the Terms and for your personal data to be collected and used for the Giveaway. The Giveaway is only open to current NUS students who must follow @NUSCFG on Instagram, like the Giveaway post, and tag three NUS friends in the comments. The Terms and Conditions for the CFG Instagram giveaway state that winners must confirm receipt of their prize within 3 days and provide requested information for verification. If a winner does not respond or breaches the terms, CFG reserves the right to withdraw the prize and select a replacement winner. Winners must collect their prize in person and participate in a photo-taking session and provide a testimonial. Employees of NUS, employers, and their immediate family are not eligible to participate. Prizes are not transferable and subject to availability. Any inappropriate or infringing content will be removed and NUS is not responsible for any technical issues or liability related to the giveaway.

NUS has the right to cancel or modify the Giveaway or its terms at any time, which will be announced on CFG's Instagram post. CFG's decision on all matters related to the Giveaway, including prizes, is final. The Giveaway is not sponsored by Instagram, but participants must still follow Instagram's terms and conditions. For any questions, contact [REDACTED_EMAIL] or [REDACTED_PHONE]. Effective as of 2 January 2025.
